revised_title: Pseudopotentials and High Temperature Superconductivity: Understanding Cuprate Superconductors
tldr: The author discusses two uses of pseudopotentials in understanding high-temperature superconductivity in cuprate superconductors. They explain the 'chemical pseudopotential' scheme and the effective 'Huckel' type hamiltonian for energy levels. The author also highlights the non-Fermi liquid character of the two-dimensional Hubbard model and the role of pseudopotentials in determining particle-particle interactions.
